page.title: 17Haverfordwest in Pembs.
page.content: Until local government reorganization Haverfordwest was the County Town of Pembrokeshire. Many local people regret the loss of status for the town and, as they see it, a remoteness of local politics. There is a movement "Bring back Pembrokeshire" which is campaigning, and has met with some success---the Post Office now accepts Pembrokeshire as an address. There is, however, an area administration office within the new county of Dyfed with an Area Education Officer. The Ministry of Agriculture maintains a local office and the Water Authority has built a new area administrative centre, but the main Post Office and Electricity Board's offices have been moved away.
